titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Postdoctoral Office, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 5, 2019 at 07:19

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of files on personnel, postdoctoral fellows, and associates and research facilities maintained by the Central Campus branch of the Yale Postdoctoral Office.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 3-D (YRG 3-D), Records documenting academic support functions at Yale.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Postdoctoral Office, 2002-2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the materials is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Postdoctoral Office, Yale University, Records (RU 917). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Established in 2002, the Yale Postdoctoral Office consists of two branches, the Central Campus branch and the School of Medicine branch. Its purpose is to assist postdoctoral fellows and associates at Yale by processing admissions, tracking postdoctoral progress, and providing orientation about Yale, New Haven, Connecticut and surrounding areas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of files on personnel, postdoctoral fellows, and associates and research facilities maintained by the Central Campus branch of the Yale Postdoctoral Office.
